com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression

Class Operand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.ExpressionEntry
      • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.Operand

  • public class Operand
extends ExpressionEntry
    It represents an operand in an expression

    An operand can be a number or a variable name

    Author:
    Fabrizio Colonna

      • Operand

        public Operand(java.lang.String varName,
       ExpressionEntry varValue,
       Memory memory)
        This constructor creates an operand which contains a variable

        If the variable it is trying to access/create is a read-only (and already alive) variable, it will use that variable as it is, without overwriting. Any further attempt to write over that variable will cause exceptions

        Parameters:
        varName - Variable name
        varValue - Variable value
        memory - Reference to the memory

      • extractNumber

        public static org.apfloat.Apfloat extractNumber(ExpressionEntry entry)
                                         throws ExpressionException
        Extract a number from an entry, if present
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to where extract the number
        Returns:
        The number contained in the entry
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - When the entry cannot be converted in a number
        ConfigException

      • getNumericValue

        public org.apfloat.Apfloat getNumericValue()
                                    throws ExpressionException
        Gets the numeric value that this object containts

        If the object contains a variable, this will be resolved and its content returned. If the objects contains a number, this will be returned. If the referenced variable is empty, the function will return null
        A referenced memory address can contain another Operand, which means that the value will be dereferenced again until a numeric value is encountered

        Returns:
        The number stored or null
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - When there is a mismatch between the variable, the memory or between internal fields

      • getVariableName

        public java.lang.String getVariableName()
        Gets the name of the variable stored.
        Returns:
        A string containing the name of the variable or null if the object contains a number

      • isMinimizable

        public boolean isMinimizable()
        An operand is minimizable only if it is not a variable
        Specified by:
        isMinimizable in class ExpressionEntry
        Returns:
        true if the expression is minimizable

      • isVariable

        public boolean isVariable()
        Checks if the objects contains a variable
        Returns:
        true if the object contain a variable and a valid memory reference

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a string representation of the entry

        The string representation is commonly used to create output expressions

        Specified by:
        toString in class ExpressionEntry
        Returns:
        A string containing a representation of the object.
